title: Raja Vidya Raja Guhya Yoga
subtitle: The Yoga of Sovereign Knowledge and Sovereign Secret
summary: In this profound chapter, Krishna reveals the most confidential knowledge - that He is the source and essence of all creation. He explains His immanence in the universe and transcendence beyond it, the process of worshiping Him through devotion (bhakti), and the glorious results of such devotion. Krishna emphasizes that those who worship other deities with faith are ultimately worshiping Him alone, though not according to proper ordinances. He concludes by declaring that those who surrender completely to Him are exceedingly dear to Him and will be liberated from the cycle of birth and death.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे | ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ||
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | idaṃ tu te guhyatamaṃ pravakṣyāmy anasūyave | jñānaṃ vijñāna-sahitaṃ yaj jñātvā mokṣyase 'śubhāt ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: To you who are free from envy, I shall reveal this most secret knowledge, combined with realization, knowing which you shall be freed from misfortune.
verses.explanation: Krishna begins by promising to disclose the most confidential knowledge that liberates one from all inauspiciousness.

verses.sanskrit: राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् | प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम् ||
verses.transliteration: rāja-vidyā rāja-guhyaṃ pavitram idam uttamam | pratyakṣāvagamaṃ dharmyaṃ susukhaṃ kartum avyayam ||
verses.translation: This is the sovereign knowledge, the sovereign secret, supremely pure, directly realizable, righteous, very joyful to perform, and imperishable.
verses.explanation: Krishna describes the nature of this knowledge - it is royal (supreme), pure, experiential, virtuous, blissful, and eternal.

verses.sanskrit: अश्रद्दधानाः पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप | अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि ||
verses.transliteration: aśraddadhānāḥ puruṣā dharmasyāsya parantapa | aprāpya māṃ nivartante mṛtyu-saṃsāra-vartmani ||
verses.translation: O scorcher of foes, those who are without faith in this dharma, not attaining Me, return to the path of death and transmigration.
verses.explanation: Those who reject this supreme path remain trapped in the cycle of birth and death.

verses.sanskrit: मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना | मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः ||
verses.transliteration: mayā tatam idaṃ sarvaṃ jagad avyakta-mūrtinā | mat-sthāni sarva-bhūtāni na cāhaṃ teṣv avasthitaḥ ||
verses.translation: By Me, in My unmanifest form, all this universe is pervaded. All beings abide in Me, but I do not abide in them.
verses.explanation: Krishna pervades all creation in His unmanifest aspect, containing all beings while transcending them.

verses.sanskrit: न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् | भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः ||
verses.transliteration: na ca mat-sthāni bhūtāni paśya me yogam aiśvaram | bhūta-bhṛn na ca bhūta-stho mamātmā bhūta-bhāvanaḥ ||
verses.translation: And yet the beings do not abide in Me - behold My divine mystery! Though I am the sustainer of all beings and the creator of all beings, My Self does not abide in them.
verses.explanation: A paradoxical truth - while Krishna sustains all existence, His essential nature remains aloof from material creation.

verses.sanskrit: यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान् | तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय ||
verses.transliteration: yathākāśa-sthito nityaṃ vāyuḥ sarvatra-go mahān | tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni mat-sthānīty upadhāraya ||
verses.translation: As the mighty wind moving everywhere rests always in space, know that all beings rest in Me in the same way.
verses.explanation: An analogy - just as wind exists within space yet space is unaffected, all beings exist within Krishna without affecting Him.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् | कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम् ||
verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūtāni kaunteya prakṛtiṃ yānti māmikām | kalpa-kṣaye punas tāni kalpādau visṛjāmy aham ||
verses.translation: O son of Kunti, at the end of the kalpa (cycle), all beings merge into My prakriti (material nature), and at the beginning of the next kalpa, I send them forth again.
verses.explanation: Krishna describes the cyclical process of cosmic dissolution and recreation.

verses.sanskrit: प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः | भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात् ||
verses.transliteration: prakṛtiṃ svām avaṣṭabhya visṛjāmi punaḥ punaḥ | bhūta-grāmam imaṃ kṛtsnam avaśaṃ prakṛter vaśāt ||
verses.translation: Taking hold of My own prakriti, I send forth again and again all this multitude of beings, helpless under the sway of prakriti.
verses.explanation: Krishna projects creation repeatedly through His material energy, which binds the beings.

verses.sanskrit: न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय | उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु ||
verses.transliteration: na ca māṃ tāni karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya | udāsīna-vad āsīnam asaktaṃ teṣu karmasu ||
verses.translation: O Dhananjaya, these works do not bind Me, for I remain as one unconcerned, unattached to those actions.
verses.explanation: Krishna remains unaffected by the cosmic processes He orchestrates.

verses.sanskrit: मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम् | हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते ||
verses.transliteration: mayādhyakṣeṇa prakṛtiḥ sūyate sacarācaram | hetunānena kaunteya jagad viparivartate ||
verses.translation: Under My supervision, prakriti produces the moving and unmoving beings. O son of Kunti, because of this the world revolves.
verses.explanation: Material nature operates under Krishna's direction, producing the diversity of creation.

verses.sanskrit: अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् | परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम् ||
verses.transliteration: avajānanti māṃ mūḍhā mānuṣīṃ tanum āśritam | paraṃ bhāvam ajānanto mama bhūta-maheśvaram ||
verses.translation: Fools disregard Me when I descend in human form, not knowing My supreme nature as the great Lord of all beings.
verses.explanation: Those without wisdom fail to recognize Krishna's divine nature when He appears as an incarnation.

verses.sanskrit: मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः | राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः ||
verses.transliteration: mogha-āśā mogha-karmāṇo mogha-jñānā vicetasaḥ | rākṣasīm āsurīṃ caiva prakṛtiṃ mohinīṃ śritāḥ ||
verses.translation: Those of vain hopes, vain actions, vain knowledge, and senseless minds assume the deluding nature of demons and evil spirits.
verses.explanation: Those who deny Krishna's divinity embody destructive qualities and delusion.

verses.sanskrit: महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः | भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम् ||
verses.transliteration: mahātmānas tu māṃ pārtha daivīṃ prakṛtim āśritāḥ | bhajanty ananya-manaso jñātvā bhūtādim avyayam ||
verses.translation: O Partha, the great souls, taking refuge of My divine nature, worship Me with single-minded devotion, knowing Me as the imperishable source of all beings.
verses.explanation: In contrast, noble souls recognize Krishna's supreme nature and worship Him exclusively.

verses.sanskrit: सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः | नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते ||
verses.transliteration: satataṃ kīrtayanto māṃ yatantaś ca dṛḍha-vratāḥ | namasyantaś ca māṃ bhaktyā nitya-yuktā upāsate ||
verses.translation: Always chanting My glories, striving with great determination, bowing down before Me, these great souls perpetually worship Me with devotion.
verses.explanation: The practices of advanced devotees include constant remembrance, determined effort, and loving worship.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते | एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम् ||
verses.transliteration: jñāna-yajñena cāpy anye yajanto mām upāsate | ekatvena pṛthaktvena bahudhā viśvato-mukham ||
verses.translation: Others worship Me through the sacrifice of knowledge, seeing Me as One, as distinct, or in various forms pervading the universe.
verses.explanation: Different approaches to worship - non-dual, dual, or multi-form conceptions of the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाहमहमौषधम् | मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम् ||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ kratur ahaṃ yajñaḥ svadhāham aham auṣadham | mantro 'ham aham evājyam aham agnir ahaṃ hutam ||
verses.translation: I am the ritual, I am the sacrifice, I am the ancestral offering, I am the medicinal herb, I am the mantra, I am the clarified butter, I am the fire, and I am the oblation.
verses.explanation: Krishna declares His presence in all aspects of Vedic rituals.

verses.sanskrit: पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः | वेद्यं पवित्रमोंकार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च ||
verses.transliteration: pitāham asya jagato mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥ | vedyaṃ pavitram oṃkāra ṛk sāma yajur eva ca ||
verses.translation: I am the father of this world, the mother, the sustainer, and the grandfather. I am the object of knowledge, the purifier, the syllable Om, and also the Rig, Sama, and Yajur Vedas.
verses.explanation: Krishna is the source, maintainer, and ultimate goal of all existence and knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत् | प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम् ||
verses.transliteration: gatir bhartā prabhuḥ sākṣī nivāsaḥ śaraṇaṃ suhṛt | prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānaṃ nidhānaṃ bījam avyayam ||
verses.translation: I am the goal, the sustainer, the master, the witness, the abode, the refuge, the friend, the origin, the dissolution, the foundation, the treasure-house, and the imperishable seed.
verses.explanation: Krishna enumerates His various relationships to creation.

verses.sanskrit: तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च | अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन ||
verses.transliteration: tapāmy aham ahaṃ varṣaṃ nigṛhṇāmy utsṛjāmi ca | amṛtaṃ caiva mṛtyuś ca sad asac cāham arjuna ||
verses.translation: I give heat, I withhold and send forth the rain. I am immortality and also death. I am being and non-being, O Arjuna.
verses.explanation: Krishna controls natural phenomena and encompasses all opposites.

verses.sanskrit: त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते | ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोकमश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान् ||
verses.transliteration: trai-vidyā māṃ soma-pāḥ pūta-pāpā yajñair iṣṭvā svarga-tiṃ prārthayante | te puṇyam āsādya surendra-lokam aśnanti divyān divi deva-bhogān ||
verses.translation: The knowers of the three Vedas, the drinkers of soma, purified of sins, worship Me by sacrifices and pray for heavenly pleasures. They go to the sacred world of Indra and enjoy celestial pleasures in heaven.
verses.explanation: Those who perform Vedic rituals for heavenly rewards attain temporary celestial enjoyment.

verses.sanskrit: ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति | एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्ना गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते ||
verses.transliteration: te taṃ bhuktvā svarga-lokaṃ viśālaṃ kṣīṇe puṇye martya-lokaṃ viśanti | evaṃ trayi-dharmam anuprapannā gatāgataṃ kāma-kāmā labhante ||
verses.translation: Having enjoyed the vast heavenly world, they return to the mortal world when their merit is exhausted. Thus following the injunctions of the three Vedas, desiring sense enjoyments, they repeatedly come and go.
verses.explanation: The limitation of Vedic rituals - they lead to temporary heavenly pleasures followed by rebirth.

verses.sanskrit: अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते | तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम् ||
verses.transliteration: ananyāś cintayanto māṃ ye janāḥ paryupāsate | teṣāṃ nityābhiyuktānāṃ yoga-kṣemaṃ vahāmy aham ||
verses.translation: To those men who worship Me alone, thinking of no other, who are ever devoted, I provide what they lack and preserve what they have.
verses.explanation: Krishna promises to personally care for the needs of His exclusive devotees.

verses.sanskrit: येऽप्यन्यदेवताभक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयाऽन्विताः | तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम् ||
verses.transliteration: ye 'py anya-devatā-bhaktā yajante śraddhayānvitāḥ | te 'pi mām eva kaunteya yajanty avidhi-pūrvakam ||
verses.translation: O son of Kunti, even those who worship other deities with faith, they too worship Me alone, though not according to proper ordinance.
verses.explanation: All worship ultimately reaches Krishna, though indirect worship lacks full efficacy.

verses.sanskrit: अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च | न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते ||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ hi sarva-yajñānāṃ bhoktā ca prabhur eva ca | na tu mām abhijānanti tattvenātaś cyavanti te ||
verses.translation: For I am the enjoyer and the only Lord of all sacrifices. But they do not know Me in truth, and hence they fall (into repeated birth and death).
verses.explanation: Krishna is the true recipient of all worship; ignorance of this truth keeps souls bound.

verses.sanskrit: यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄन्यान्ति पितृव्रताः | भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम् ||
verses.transliteration: yānti deva-vratā devān pitṝn yānti pitṛ-vratāḥ | bhūtāni yānti bhūtejyā yānti mad-yājino 'pi mām ||
verses.translation: Worshipers of the gods go to the gods; worshipers of the ancestors go to the ancestors; worshipers of spirits go to the spirits; but My worshipers come to Me.
verses.explanation: Different forms of worship lead to different destinations; only devotion to Krishna leads to Him.

verses.sanskrit: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति | तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः ||
verses.transliteration: patraṃ puṣpaṃ phalaṃ toyaṃ yo me bhaktyā prayacchati | tad ahaṃ bhakty-upahṛtam aśnāmi prayatātmanaḥ ||
verses.translation: Whoever offers Me with devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit, or water—that offering of love from the pure-hearted I accept.
verses.explanation: Krishna values loving devotion over material opulence in offerings.

verses.sanskrit: यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् | यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम् ||
verses.transliteration: yat karoṣi yad aśnāsi yaj juhoṣi dadāsi yat | yat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣva mad-arpaṇam ||
verses.translation: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer in sacrifice, whatever you give, whatever austerity you practice—do that, O son of Kunti, as an offering to Me.
verses.explanation: The essence of karma yoga - dedicating all activities to Krishna.

verses.sanskrit: शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः | संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि ||
verses.transliteration: śubhāśubha-phalair evaṃ mokṣyase karma-bandhanaiḥ | sannyāsa-yoga-yuktātmā vimukto mām upaiṣyasi ||
verses.translation: Thus you shall be freed from the bondage of actions, bearing good and bad results. With your mind steadfast in the yoga of renunciation, you shall become free and come to Me.
verses.explanation: By offering all actions to Krishna, one transcends karmic bondage.

verses.sanskrit: समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः | ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम् ||
verses.transliteration: samo 'haṃ sarva-bhūteṣu na me dveṣyo 'sti na priyaḥ | ye bhajanti tu māṃ bhaktyā mayi te teṣu cāpy aham ||
verses.translation: I am equally disposed to all beings; there is none hateful or dear to Me. But those who worship Me with devotion are in Me, and I too am in them.
verses.explanation: While Krishna is impartial, He establishes a special reciprocal relationship with His devotees.

verses.sanskrit: अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् | साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः ||
verses.transliteration: api cet su-durācāro bhajate mām ananya-bhāk | sādhur eva sa mantavyaḥ samyag vyavasito hi saḥ ||
verses.translation: Even if the most sinful worships Me with exclusive devotion, he should be considered righteous, for he has rightly resolved.
verses.explanation: Exclusive devotion to Krishna purifies even the greatest sinner.

verses.sanskrit: क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति | कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति ||
verses.transliteration: kṣipraṃ bhavati dharmātmā śaśvac chāntiṃ nigacchati | kaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśyati ||
verses.translation: He soon becomes righteous and attains lasting peace. O son of Kunti, declare boldly that My devotee never perishes.
verses.explanation: Devotional surrender transforms one's nature and ensures eternal welfare.

verses.sanskrit: मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः | स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम् ||
verses.transliteration: māṃ hi pārtha vyapāśritya ye 'pi syuḥ pāpa-yonayaḥ | striyo vaiśyās tathā śūdrās te 'pi yānti parāṃ gatim ||
verses.translation: O Partha, even those born of sinful wombs—women, vaishyas, and shudras too—taking refuge in Me, attain the supreme goal.
verses.explanation: Krishna's grace is available to all, regardless of birth or social status.

verses.sanskrit: किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा | अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम् ||
verses.transliteration: kiṃ punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā rājarṣayas tathā | anityam asukhaṃ lokam imaṃ prāpya bhajasva mām ||
verses.translation: How much more then the righteous brahmanas and devoted royal sages! Having obtained this transient and joyless world, worship Me.
verses.explanation: If even those from disadvantaged backgrounds can attain the supreme, how much more can the spiritually inclined.

verses.sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु | मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः ||
verses.transliteration: man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṃ namaskuru | mām evaiṣyasi yuktvaivam ātmānaṃ mat-parāyaṇaḥ ||
verses.translation: Fix your mind on Me, be devoted to Me, worship Me, bow down to Me. Thus uniting yourself with Me and making Me your supreme goal, you shall surely come to Me.
verses.explanation: Krishna's concluding instruction - complete absorption in Him leads to Him.
